article.headline: Pepperdine 82, Long Beach State 78
article.story: LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) -- Alex Acker had 25 points and nine rebounds on Tuesday night to propel Pepperdine to an 82-78 win over Long Beach State. Long Beach State rallied in the second half after trailing 52-37 with 18:36 to play, tying the game 66-66 with 6:59 to play after a dunk by Sam Byrd. But the 49ers succumbed down the stretch to the sharp-shooting Waves (3-1), who made 25 of 45 from the floor, including a torrid 12-for-17 from 3-point range. With Pepperdine leading 81-78 with 32 seconds to play, Long Beach State had possession and a chance for the lead, but Anthony Coleman took a forced, off-balance 3-point shot from the corner for an air ball with 21 seconds remaining. Acker sealed the victory for Pepperdine, making two free throws with 14 seconds to play to give the Waves an 82-78 lead. Coleman led Long Beach State (0-2) with 17 points and six rebounds. In the first half, Pepperdine made 9 of 11 from beyond the 3-point line and 15 of 22 overall to lead 45-37 at the break.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
